name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/QoS2
desc: This service provides access to Quality of Service settings on a router or other network infrastructure device.

GetLANQoSSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/GetLANQoSSettings
GetLANQoSSettings.desc: This action gets the QoS settings related to prioritizing wired LAN traffic.

ethernetPortPriorities.desc: The priorities of the Ethernet switch ports. The first array entry corresponds to the first switch port, the second entry to the second switch port and so on.

GetQoSSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/GetQoSSettings
GetQoSSettings.desc: This action gets the QoS settings related to all traffic passing handled by this network infrastructure device.

isQoSAutoPrioritizingEnabled.desc: Whether QoS auto-prioritizing is currently enabled. QoS auto-prioritizing automatically assigns QoS priorities for devices from values returned from a web-service. When enabled, device priorities are automatically updated as device becomes more accurately identified.

upstreamBandwidthbps.desc: The upstream bandwidth, in bits per second. This value is used effectively allocate bandwidth between all data streams. The closer this value is to the actual value, the more efficient the QoS system will operate. If this value is 0, the upstream bandwidth is determined automatically.

downstreamBandwidthbps.desc: The downstream bandwidth, in bits per second. This value is used effectively allocate bandwidth between all data streams. The closer this value is to the actual value, the more efficient the QoS system will operate. If this value is 0, the downstream bandwidth is determined automatically.

deviceRules.desc: The list of rules that apply to specific devices. This value is returned regardless of the value of isQoSEnabled.

applicationRules.desc: The list of rules that apply to specific applications. This value is returned regardless of the value of isQoSEnabled.

maxDescriptionLength.desc: The maximum allowed length of a rule description.

maxApplicationRules.desc: The maximum number of QoS application rules that can exist simultaneously.

maxPortRanges.desc: The maximum number of port ranges allowed per application rule.

maxDeviceRules.desc: The maximum number of QoS device rules that can exist simultaneously.

GetQoSSettings2.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/GetQoSSettings2
GetQoSSettings2.desc: This action gets the QoS settings related to all traffic passing handled by this network infrastructure device.

maxAutoAssignedDeviceRules.desc: The number of auto-assigned QoS rules allowed which apply to specific devices. Once this limit is reached, subsequent rules will be ignored.

maxAutoAssignedApplicationRules.desc: The number of auto-assigned QoS rules allowed which apply to specific applications. Once this limit is reached, subsequent rules will be ignored.

autoAssignedDeviceRules.desc: The list of auto-assigned rules that apply to specific devices.

autoAssignedApplicationRules.desc: The list of auto-assigned rules that apply to specific applications.

GetWLANQoSSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/GetWLANQoSSettings
GetWLANQoSSettings.desc: This action gets the QoS settings related to prioritizing wireless LAN traffic.

isWMMEnabled.desc: Whether Wireless Multimedia (WMM) is currently enabled.

isWirelessAcknowledgementEnabled.desc: Whether wireless acknowledgement is currently enabled.

SetLANQoSSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/SetLANQoSSettings
SetLANQoSSettings.desc: This action sets the QoS settings related to prioritizing wired LAN traffic.

ethernetPortPriorities.desc: The priorities of the Ethernet switch ports. The first array entry corresponds to the first switch port, the second entry to the second switch port and so on. The length of this array cannot exceed to number of ports on the device.

errors.ErrorInvalidPortCount: The length of the priority array exceeded the number of ports on the device.

SetQoSSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/SetQoSSettings
SetQoSSettings.desc: This action sets the QoS settings.

isQoSAutoPrioritizingEnabled.desc: Whether QoS auto-prioritizing is currently enabled.

upstreamBandwidthbps.desc: The upstream bandwidth, in bits per second. This value is used effectively allocate bandwidth between all data streams. The closer this value is to the actual value, the more efficient the QoS system will operate. If this value is 0, the upstream bandwidth is determined automatically.

downstreamBandwidthbps.desc: The downstream bandwidth, in bits per second. This value is used effectively allocate bandwidth between all data streams. The closer this value is to the actual value, the more efficient the QoS system will operate. If this value is 0, the downstream bandwidth is determined automatically.

deviceRules.desc: The list of rules that apply to specific devices. If the value of the isQoSEnabled parameter is false, the new rules are saved but have no immediate effect.

applicationRules.desc: The list of rules that apply to specific applications. If the value of the isQoSEnabled parameter is false, the rules are saved but have no immediate no effect.

errors.ErrorConflictingApplicationRules: Two or more of the application rules contain conflicting port ranges.
errors.ErrorConflictingDeviceRules: Two or more of the device rules contain conflicting MAC addresses.
errors.ErrorDescriptionTooLong: One of the specified rule descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
errors.ErrorInvalidDownstreamBandwidth: The specified downstream bandwidth was less than 0.
errors.ErrorInvalidPortRange: One of the application rule port ranges contained an invalid port range.
errors.ErrorInvalidUpstreamBandwidth: The specified upstream bandwidth was less than 0.
errors.ErrorTooManyApplicationRules: The number of application rules exceeded the maximum allowed.
errors.ErrorTooManyDeviceRules: The number of device rules exceeded the maximum allowed.
errors.ErrorTooManyPortRanges: One of the application rule port ranges contained more than the maximum allowed number.

SetWLANQoSSettings.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/SetWLANQoSSettings
SetWLANQoSSettings.desc: This action sets the QoS settings related to prioritizing wireless LAN traffic.

isWMMEnabled.desc: Whether Wireless Multimedia (WMM) should be enabled.

isWirelessAcknowledgementEnabled.desc: Whether wireless acknowledgement should be enabled.

UpdateAutoAssignedRules.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/qos/UpdateAutoAssignedRules
UpdateAutoAssignedRules.desc: DEPRECATED: This action does nothing and will always return an 'OK' result.

portRanges.desc: The set of port ranges which define this application rule.

trafficType.desc: The type of traffic the application will be producing or consuming.

description.desc: A human-readable description of the rule.

macAddress.desc: The MAC address whose traffic is governed by the rule.

priority.desc: The priority assigned to the traffic governed by the rule.

trafficType.desc: The type of traffic the device will be typically producing or consuming.

description.desc: A human-readable description of the rule.

protocol.desc: The protocol of the port range.

firstPort.desc: The first port in the port range. This value must be between 0 and 65535

lastPort.desc: The last port in the port range. This value must be between 0 and 65535 and greater than or equal to firstPort. If not present, the value of firstPortwill be used.

priority.desc: The priority of the traffic matching this port range.

QoSTrafficType.Background: Background traffic. This type should be used for non-urgent types of network traffic, such as FTP.
QoSTrafficType.Generic: Generic/undefined traffic. This type should be used when the traffic type is unknown or does not resemble one of the other supported traffic types.
QoSTrafficType.Voice: Voice traffic. This type should be specified to optimize for traffic with characteristics of voice data.
QoSTrafficType.Video: Video traffic. This type should be specified to optimize for traffic with characteristics of video data.
